SearchPage.title: Search
SearchPage.advancedSearchText1: By default the search only searches the title of videos. This can be modified by searching a specific video field.
SearchPage.advancedSearchText2: Use the field:query syntax to search a specific field.
SearchPage.advancedSearchTextExample1: Searching for videos with a title title:my awesome video
SearchPage.advancedSearchTextExample2: Searching for videos in a chapter (category) chapter:Path of Exile
SearchPage.advancedSearchText5: Note: For ID searches if the UUID fails to parse it will fallback to searching the title.

cancel.title: Cancel queue item
cancel.text: Are you sure you want to cancel this queue item?
cancel.description: For live archives this will stop the video and chat download then proceed with post-processing. For VOD archives this will stop all the tasks.

settings.title: Settings
settings.description: Settings are persisted in local browser storage
settings.smoothScrollDescription: Enable smooth scrolling for new chat messages. May look bad if there is a large volume of messages per second.
settings.chatHistogramDescription: Display a visual representation of chat message throughout the video below the video player.
settings.showProcessingVideos: Show Processing Videos in Recently Archived Videos
settings.showProcessingVideosDescription: Display processing videos in the 'Recently Archived' videos section on the home page.

ArchivePage.title: Archive
ArchivePage.inputMessage: Please enter a video ID or select a channel
ArchivePage.invalidMessage: Please either enter a video ID or select a channel (not both)
ArchivePage.successMessage: Video has been added to the queue
ArchivePage.message: Enter a video ID or select a channel to archive a live stream.

AdminBlockedVideosPage.title: Admin - Blocked Videos
AdminBlockedVideosPage.body: External platform video IDs that are blocked from being archived.

AdminChannelsPage.title: Admin - Channels
AdminChannelsPage.storageSizeDisclaimerText: Storage size is not updated instantly. A background task runs every hour to recalculate it.

headerDescription.part3: for more information about each setting.

applicationSettings.availableVariables: Available variables to use in the template:

archiveSettings.livestreamCheckIntervalDescription: The interval in seconds to check for new live streams to archive. Recommended is 60 seconds, do not go less than 30 seconds. REQUIRES RESTART!
archiveSettings.videoCheckIntervalDescription: The interval in minutes to check for new videos to archive. REQUIRES RESTART!
archiveSettings.generateSpriteThumbnailsDescription: Generate a sprite thumbnail for the video. These are preview thumbnails when hovering over the video timeline.
archiveSettings.encodeAV1Description: Generate an additional AV1-encoded version of each video for better compression and quality. The AV1 version will be served to browsers that support it.
archiveSettings.storageTemplateSettingsDescription: Customize how folders and files are named. This only applied to new files. To apply to existing files execute the migration task on the tasks page.

videoSettings.twitchTokenDescription: Supply your Twitch token for downloading ad-free live streams and subscriber-only VODs.
videoSettings.convertFFmpegArgsDescription: Custom FFmpeg arguments to use when converting the video. This is used for both live and VOD archives.
videoSettings.encodeAV1Description: Generate an additional AV1-encoded version of each video for better compression and quality. The AV1 version will be served to browsers that support it.
videoSettings.convertAV1FFmpegArgsDescription: Custom FFmpeg arguments to use when creating the AV1 version of the video. Uses libsvtav1 encoder by default.
videoSettings.ytdlpVideoArgsDescription: Custom yt-dlp arguments to use when downloading a video. This is only used for VOD downloads.
videoSettings.ytdlpLiveArgsDescription: Custom yt-dlp arguments to use when downloading a live stream. This is only used for live stream downloads.
videoSettings.proxySettingsDescription: Archive live streams through a proxy to prevent ads. Your Twitch token is not sent to the proxy.
videoSettings.whitelistChannelsDescription: Select channels that are excluded from using the proxy if enabled. Instead your Twitch token will be used. Select channels that you are subscribed to.

AdminTasksPage.title: Admin - Tasks
AdminTasksPage.taskStartedNotification: Task started, see container logs for more information.
AdminTasksPage.checkWatchedChannelsLive: Check watched channels for live streams to archive
AdminTasksPage.checkWatchedChannelsLiveDescription: Occurs at interval set in the config.
AdminTasksPage.checkWatchedChannelsVideo: Check watched channels for new videos to archive
AdminTasksPage.checkWatchedChannelsVideoDescription: Occurs at interval set in the config.
AdminTasksPage.checkWatchedChannelsClips: Check watched channels for new clips to archive
AdminTasksPage.storageTemplateMigrationDescription: Apply storage template to existing files. Read the documentation before executing.
AdminTasksPage.pruneVideosDescription: Delete videos that are older than the retention period set in the channel settings. Occurs daily at 00:00.
AdminTasksPage.jwks: Fetch JSON Web Key Sets (JWKS) from SSO provider
AdminTasksPage.saveChaptersForVideosDescription: Save chapters for videos that have been archived (automatically happens for new archives).
AdminTasksPage.updateLiveStreamIds: Update Live Stream IDs with Video IDs
AdminTasksPage.updateLiveStreamIdsDescription: Attempt to update live stream archives with their corresponding video ID (automatically does this after live archive finishes).
AdminTasksPage.generateSpriteThumbnailsDescription: Generate preview thumbnails seen when hovering over the player progress bar for all videos. This automatically runs after every video archive.
AdminTasksPage.updateVideoStorageUsageDescription: Update the storage usage for all videos. This is used to display the storage usage in the video list and statistics page. Runs every hour.
AdminTasksPage.processPlaylistVideoRulesDescription: Process video rules for playlists. This will check if videos should be added to playlists based on the rules defined. Runs every hour.

validation.id: ID must have at least 2 characters

AdminBlockedVideosComponents.deleteConfirmText: Are you sure you want to unblock this video?
AdminBlockedVideosComponents.multiUnblockText: Are you sure you want to unblock the {length} selected blocked videos?

validation.displayName: Display name must have at least 2 characters

validation.imagePath: Image path must have at least 3 characters
validation.channelName: Channel name must have at least 2 characters

AdminChannelsComponents.deleteConfirmText: Are you sure you want to delete this channel?
AdminChannelsComponents.videoRetentionLabel: If this setting is enabled channel videos will be deleted (including files) after the specified number of days. 'Lock' a video to prevent it from being deleted.
AdminChannelsComponents.videoRetentionWarning: Videos will be deleted after {number} days!
AdminChannelsComponents.videoRetentionDaysLabel: Number of days to retain videos

validation.id: ID must have at least 2 characters

AdminQueueComponents.deleteConfirmText: Are you sure you want to delete this queue item?
AdminQueueComponents.deleteConfirmText2: This action does not delete any files
AdminQueueComponents.multiDeleteConfirmText: Are you sure you want to delete the {number} selected queue items?

validation.id: ID must have at least 2 characters
validation.username: Username must have at least 3 characters

AdminUserComponents.deleteConfirmText: Are you sure you want to delete this user?

validation.title: Title must have at least 1 character
validation.extId: External ID must have at least 1 character
validation.duration: Duration must be at least 1 second

AdminVideoComponents.deleteConfirmText: Are you sure you want to delete this video?
AdminVideoComponents.multiDeleteConfirmText: Are you sure you want to delete the {number} selected videos?

AdminWatchedComponents.deleteConfirmText: Are you sure you want to delete this watched channel?
AdminWatchedComponents.headerText: Read the watched channel <wiki>wiki page</wiki> for more information about each feature.
AdminWatchedComponents.liveStreamsDescription: Archive live streams as they are broadcasted.
AdminWatchedComponents.videosOccurrence: Check for new videos occurs once a day.
AdminWatchedComponents.downloadSubOnlyDescription: Do not check this if you are not a subscriber. Must have Twitch token set in Admin > Settings to download subscriber-only videos.
AdminWatchedComponents.channelClipsDescription1: This feature is meant to archive the most popular (view count) clips from the past 'interval' days. For example, if you set number of clips to 5 and interval to 7, the top 5 clips from the past 7 days will be archived. It will not run again until 7 days have passed. No restrictions (categories, age, title, regex, etc) are applied to this.
AdminWatchedComponents.channelClipsMoreInformationText: If you want to perform a one-time import of a channel's most popular clips, set the interval to a large number (1000) and the number of clips to a large number (250). This will import the top 250 clips from the past 1000 days. It is recommended to change the interval and number of clips to a lower number after the initial import.
AdminWatchedComponents.intervalDaysDescription: How often channel is checked for clips to archive (in days). This also limits the clip search to the last interval days.
AdminWatchedComponents.ignoreLastCheckedDateDescription: Clips are only checked if the last checked date is older than the interval days. If this is checked, the last checked date is ignored and all clips from the last interval days are checked.
AdminWatchedComponents.maxVideoAgeDescription: Archive videos that are not older than this number of days (0 to archive all).
AdminWatchedComponents.titleRegexDescription: Use regex to filter and match specific patterns in livestream and video titles. See <wiki>the wiki</wiki> for more information.
AdminWatchedComponents.applyToVideosDescription: Apply this regex to video downloads, applies to live streams only by default
AdminWatchedComponents.categoriesDescription: Archive videos and live streams from select categories. Leave blank to archive all categories.
AdminWatchedComponents.updateMetadataDescription: Update live stream metadata after {minutes} minutes of the live stream archive starting. This includes thumbnails and title. Set to 0 to disable.

validation.password: Password must have at least 8 characters

AuthComponents.passwordTooShort: Password should have at least 8 characters
AuthComponents.registerLinkText: Don't have an account? Sign up

notifications.testEnterVideoId: Enter a video ID to test the rules
notifications.rulesMatchedText: Video would be added to the playlist
notifications.rulesNotMatchedText: Video would not be added to the playlist

automationRules.title: Editing Video Automation Rules for Playlist "{playlistName}"
automationRules.descriptionOne: Playlist video automation rules can have multiple groups with multiple rules inside each group. Each group has a single "group operator" that controls how rules are evaluated within a group. Multiple groups use the "OR" operator.
automationRules.descriptionTwo: For example, if you have one group with the "AND" operator and two rules inside it, both rules must pass for the video to be added to the playlist.
automationRules.descriptionThree: Enable debug logs and check the log output to see how rules are being evaluated.
